NEW YORK , May 19 , 2014 ( BUSINESS WIRE ) -- Fitch Ratings affirms the notes issued by Pennsylvania Higher Education Assistance Agency Series 2013-1 at ' AAAsf ' .

The credit quality of the trust collateral is high , in Fitch 's opinion , based on the guarantees provided by the transaction 's eligible guarantors and reinsurance provided by the U.S. Department of Education ( ED ) for at least 97 % of principal and accrued interest .

RelatedSentence: The credit quality of the trust collateral is high , in Fitch 's opinion , based on the guarantees provided by the transaction 's eligible guarantors and reinsurance provided by the U.S. Department of Education ( ED ) for at least 97 % of principal and accrued interest .
Fitch affirmed at ' AAA ' and assigned a Stable Outlook to the U.S. sovereign rating on March 24 , 2014 .
Sufficient Credit Enhancement ( CE ) : CE is provided by overcollateralization ( OC ; the excess of trust 's asset balance over bond balance ) , and excess spread .
Adequate Liquidity Support : Liquidity support is provided by a Debt Service Reserve Fund sized at the greater of 0.25 % of the pool balance and $ 893,445 .
Fitch has reviewed the servicing operations of PHEAA and believes PHEAA to be an acceptable servicer of FFELP student loans .

Since the FFELP student loan ABS relies on the U.S. government to reimburse defaults , ' AAAsf ' FFELP ABS ratings will likely move in tandem with the ' AAA ' U.S. sovereign rating .
